result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew T. Harvey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew T. Harvey is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matthew T. Harvey was found guilty of Felony Murder - Substantial Battery PTAC, an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.03.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in 48 hours if one is received.  No contact w/A.P. or his family.  No contact w/A.I's family.  Not to go to taverns/bars or business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol or drug paraphernalia.  Absolute Sobriety. Sign release form for any medical, assessment, etc. Random UAs.
Seek & maintain full time employment, schooling or combination of both.
Payable out of 25% of inmate funds while incarcerated, balance as a condition of community supervision.  Pay victims first then Crime Victim Compensation.

Defendant Matthew T. Harvey in court with attorney Daniel Mark Berkos.  Defendant Matthew T. Harvey in custody.  Kevin R. Calkins and Linda Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties prepared to proceed.  Parties reviewed and recv'd PSI.  P.I. (Aunt of victim) makes statement. S.I. (wife of victim) makes statement.  P I (mother of victim) makes statement.  State plays video of statements of victims children. K.G. (mother of defendant) makes statement.  State makes statement and gives recommendation 12 yrs I.C./6 yrs E.S..  Atty. Berkos makes statement and recommendation 6-8 years I.C.and whatever years Court decides for E.S.. Defendant makes statement.  Court admonishes DE and makes statement. VIS video to be sealed.  Felony admonishments. Court imposes sentence.

Sentencing hearing on September 14, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on September 29, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Matthew T. Harvey in court with attorney Daniel Mark Berkos.  Defendant Matthew T. Harvey in custody.  Kevin R. Calkins and Linda Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Matter set for a plea hearing today.  Court notes they received amended information.  Atty Berkos acknowledges rec. 5 count information and went over that w/his client.  Court reads all five charges and maximum penalties to the DE.  Parties discuss potential fine on Ct 5.  Atty Berkos states DE is aware of the maximum fine and if the parties discuss between now and the sentencing date that there would be no fine that the DE would benefit from that so they would not argue that.  DE agrees.  Court continues w/the max penalties for Ct 5.  Atty Berkos states an agreement has been reached and files a plea questionaire w/the Court.  Atty Berkos notes DE will enter a Guilty Alford plea to count 5 and explains the reason for that is due to possible civil issues.  State would then move to dismiss Counts 1-4.  Atty Berkos states there is a joint recommendation for a PSI and then the State wouldn't recommend more than 12 years initial confinement and the defense would be free to argue.  DE pleads Alford Plea Guilty to Count 5.  Court questions DE on plea.  DE advised of felony firearms warnings and voting rights.  State requests Court take judicial notice of transcript of jury trial in 15CF360.  Atty Berkos doesn't object.  Court takes judicial notice of transcript of jury trial in 15CF360.  Court accepts alford plea and finds DE guilty of Ct 5 and dismisses counts 1 through 4.  Atty Berkos and DE request PSI.  Parties requests half a day for sentencing hearing.  Court goes off the record to discuss scheduling sentencing hearing.  Back on the record, the Court sets sentencing date and orders PSI be completed no later than 9/8/2017.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Amended
Plea hearing on July 3, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Matthew T. Harvey in court with attorney Daniel Mark Berkos.  Defendant Matthew T. Harvey in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman and Kevin Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Court notes he rec'd letter from State dated 6/9/2017.  State also rec'd it.  Motion today re: admissibility of evidence of four different things and the Court cites them all.  Atty Berkos responds to letter by the State and the cases they cited.  State responds briefly.  Atty Berkos responds.  Court addresses each of the four:  Court will allow activities at Kwik Trip to be introduced.  Court will allow events that happened at the Walnut St. Tavern to be admitted.  Any text message during said time period that DE rec'd from Mr. Robinson would be admissible.  Court addresses final issue re: O.E. testimony and the Court will allow it at this time.  State addresses no witness list from the DE yet except for one expert.  Atty Berkos states that will be his only witness unless the DE decides to testify.  He is awaiting something in writing from that expert.  Atty Berkos addresses written order to allow DE to wear street clothes at jury trial.  Atty Berkos to provide an order for the Court's signature.  State says they will draft an order to include all witnesses.  State notes she wants discussion on logistics as to the viewing of the scene at further hearings.  Court will address that at a later date.  Court is in recess.
2nd Amended
Cover Letter from Atty. Hoffman
Motion hearing on June 13, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Kevin Calkins and Linda Hoffman appear in court for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Daniel Berkos appears in court.  Defendant Matthew T. Harvey appears in court, in custody.  All parties received each others motions that the Court received.  Court gratnts State's motions in limine 1-7.  Court grants defense motions in limine.  Court address pre trial motions admissibility.  Atty. Berkos opposes (2) co defendants state of mind, irrelevant to client.  State states motion is proof of intent, motive and context.  Atty. Berkos would stipulate to Robinson.  ADA Hoffman argues still need to bring in evidence on how we got to where we are.  Court would like to revisit this motion at 3:30 on June 13th.  State to supplement by this Friday.  State recv'd notice on Friday on expert witness.  Not adequate notice of expert and opinion.  Atty. Berkos comments and will hopefully get summary of testimony soon.  Expert wants to see items (instruments) used.  Court address' with the parties about juror questionnaires.  Court denies juror requests 3,5,11.  Court grants juror request 1,4,6 & 7.  Court grants 8,9 &10. Court is going to have COC further inquire with #2 on being back on the 10th.

Defendant Matthew T. Harvey in court with attorney Daniel M. Berkos.  Defendant Matthew T. Harvey in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Information received by counsel, waived reading.  Court goes through information with defendant orally.  Defendant agrees with receipt of document.  Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial Br. 1.  Bond continues.  Court addresses other argn. dates pending for co-defendants in the next week.  Requests scheduling conference be held once all argn. dates are held.  State advises no status or receipt of autopsy report.  Attorney Berkos advises court there will be an expert named to review the report.  Scheduling will likely be set 30 days after the last argn. date of co-defendants.  Parties agree.
Arraignment at 12-01-2015 11:00 am

Defendant Matthew T. Harvey in court with attorney Daniel M. Berkos.  Defendant Matthew T. Harvey in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan and Linda Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  MH to address release of the victim's remains to be heard today.  Atty Ryan states they have asked the Sauk County Coroner to testify briefly.  State calls Greg Hahn - S&T.  Atty Berkos does cross-exam.  Witness excused.  State has nothing further and Atty Berkos has no argument.  Atty Ryan makes argument.  Court asks questions of Atty Ryan and he responds.  Atty Berkos responds w/his argument.  Court asks questions of Atty Berkos and he responds.  Court finds the DE's decision to wait re: further autopsy requests at this point is reasonable.  Court will not allow the return of the body to the family at this time.  Court notes the co-DE's in this matter have all waived the return of the body and notes the DE can do the same should he decide to do that at a later date.  Court will not set a deadline on this matter but suggests a status conference be set.  Nothing further from the parties.  Court is adjourned.

Demand for Severance of Defendants

Defendant Matthew T. Harvey in court with attorney Daniel M. Berkos.  Defendant Matthew T. Harvey in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan and Linda Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Hoffman calls Det.  George Bonham - BPD - S&T.  Witness ID's DE Rotar.  Record to reflect ID.  Atty Hoffman continues direct of Det. Bonham.  Witness ID's DE Nash.  Record to reflect ID.  Atty Hoffman continues direct of Det. Bonham.  Witness ID's DE Harvey.  Record to reflect ID.  Atty Covey stipulates to the ID of his client DE Robinson.  Atty Hoffman continues direct of Det. Bonham.  Atty Berkos does cross-exam of Det. Bonham.  Atty Schulenburg does cross-exam of Det. Bonham.  Atty Newton does cross-exam of Det. Bonham.  Atty Covey does cross-exam of Det. Bonham.  State has no questions and the witness is excused.  Defense attorney's have no witnesses at this time.  State waives argument.  Atty Berkos states argument.  Atty Schulenburg states argument.  Atty Newton states argument.  Atty Covey states argument.  Court finds as to each of the four DE's that there is probable cause to believe a felony was committed and binds them all over for trial.  Court addresses motion for bond modification filed by Atty Newton.  Atty Newton agrees to have that heard at a later date.  Atty Hoffman files a stipulation as to Nash's case and Robinson's case.  Atty Hoffman requests hearing be set in re: to the release of the victim.  Atty Berkos responds re: release of the body.  States he would like to review the autopsy report prior to making a decision.  State is aware of the objection.  Court states they will be in touch w/the State and Atty Berkos to set a hearing date/time.  Atty Covey notes that the RD on 11/3/2015 will likely not be necessary and an arraignment will be set at a later date and time.  Court says matter will remain on the calendar for now but doesn't believe all four if any of the DE's will be here for that date.

Defendant Matthew T. Harvey in court with attorney Daniel M. Berkos.  Defendant Matthew T. Harvey in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions Atty Berkos whether his motion should be heard yet this morning or at a later time.  Atty Berkos responds.  Parties discuss motion filed this morning by Atty Berkos.  Court states in his eyes the matters are joined.  Atty Berkos addresses different defenses and motion re: severance.  Atty Ryan responds.  Atty Berkos responds.  Court denies request by Atty Berkos at this time but notes it may need to be revisited at a later time.

Preliminary hearing at 10-14-2015 09:00 am.
Return date at 11-03-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant Matthew T. Harvey appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Deb ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Michael X. Albrecht appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State moves to amend complaint - victim should be A.P. not A.R.  Court does amend.  State requests $100,000.00 Cash bail.  State gives history of DE.  Atty. ORourke argues for much lower cash.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits NOT waived.  $100,000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact w/coactors C.N., J.R. or A.R. or surviving victim A.P.; Not leave State of WI  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
